sentences.en: Extrapolating from his latest findings, he reckons about 80% of these deaths might be attributed to smoking.
sentences.cn: 从他最近的发现推断，他估计大约80%的这类死亡可能归因于吸烟。

sentences.en: It's Model Biological Systems 101 : study an animal that's easy to study, and then extrapolate.
sentences.cn: 这就像生物系统模型 101: 先研究一种容易研究的动物, 然后再以此作出推断.

sentences.en: One can extrapolate the size of the building from the measurements of an average room.
sentences.cn: 从一间屋子的量度可以推断出整座建筑物的大小.

sentences.en: There's more work to do and much to extrapolate.
sentences.cn: 有更多外推的工作要做的和.

sentences.en: They extrapolate from the electronic image its evanescence itsits virtual, metamorphic and above its neurotic nature.
sentences.cn: 他们在作品中抓住了电子图像消亡、变化、虚拟 、 变形和最多的神经机能的本质.

sentences.en: They extrapolate that to say I'm choosing to kill people. It's not like that.
sentences.cn: 他们说我是自己选择终结别人的生命, 不是这样的.

sentences.en: You can extrapolate these findings to any tumors in the body.
sentences.cn: 你能够将这些发现推定到身体上的任何一种肿瘤上.

trans.tran_cn: （由已知资料对未知事实或价值）推算，推断
trans.tran_en: to use facts about the present or about one thing or group to make a guess about the future or about other things or groups
